summary.overview: The Random Number Generator application allows users to generate a random number within a specified range. Users can input minimum and maximum values, generate a random number, and copy the result to the clipboard.
summary.predefined_options: Default minimum value is set to 1 and maximum value is set to 100 if no input is provided.
summary.external_resources: Google Fonts for Poppins font family (https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Poppins:wght@400;600&display=swap).

requirements.description: When the user enters a numerical value in the 'Min' input field, the system should accept and store this value as the minimum range for generating a random number.
When the user enters a numerical value in the 'Max' input field, the system should accept and store this value as the maximum range for generating a random number.
When the user clicks the 'Generate Random Number' button, the system should generate a random number between the specified 'Min' and 'Max' values and display it in the 'randomNumber' display element.
When the random number is displayed, the system should visually scale the 'randomNumber' display element to 1.2 times its size for 300 milliseconds and then revert to its original size.
When the user clicks the 'Copy to Clipboard' button, the system should copy the current random number displayed in the 'randomNumber' element to the clipboard.
After copying the random number to the clipboard, the system should change the 'Copy to Clipboard' button text to 'Copied!' for 2000 milliseconds and then revert it back to 'Copy to Clipboard'.
